poem:
### Framing Mong Kok

In the lens, crumbling whispers of Mong Kok,  
rusted balconies hold stories,  
a mosaic of neon and earth—  
faded calligraphy in concrete veins.  
Howard clicks hope into history's light,  
captures shadows of the skyline,  
and in each pixel, a heartbeat—  
Hong Kong breathes,  
immortalized in digital dusk.

He feels passionately about the history of the region where he was born and bred, and had hoped to capture what he regards as one of its most distinctive types of historical building". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
